response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (19)", "high", "Being a young adult is associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking behaviors, increasing the chance of recidivism."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "high", "Statistical evidence shows young males tend to have higher rates of reoffending."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race as White has not been strongly correlated with higher recidivism risk in most models."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "A single arrest without conviction signals some exposure to the criminal justice system, though the lack of a conviction lessens the risk."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding 2 jobs during the year indicates some level of labor engagement, but job turnover or instability may pose moderate risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Having a high school diploma without further education points to moderate risk due to fewer opportunities for advancement."],
    ["Marital and Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married can indicate a lower degree of social support, which is moderately linked to recidivism."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana)", "medium", "Recent drug use, even if only marijuana, contributes as a moderate risk factor for reoffending."],
    ["Family Background", "low", "A stable upbringing in a household with both biological parents in a rural setting acts as a protective factor."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Attributing personal events to a higher power may act as a stabilizing, protective factor against recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult is associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking behaviors, increasing the chance of recidivism.
Statistical evidence shows young males tend to have higher rates of reoffending.
Race as White has not been strongly correlated with higher recidivism risk in most models.
A single arrest without conviction signals some exposure to the criminal justice system, though the lack of a conviction lessens the risk.
Holding 2 jobs during the year indicates some level of labor engagement, but job turnover or instability may pose moderate risk.
Having a high school diploma without further education points to moderate risk due to fewer opportunities for advancement.
Living alone and never having been married can indicate a lower degree of social support, which is moderately linked to recidivism.
Recent drug use, even if only marijuana, contributes as a moderate risk factor for reoffending.
A stable upbringing in a household with both biological parents in a rural setting acts as a protective factor.
Attributing personal events to a higher power may act as a stabilizing, protective factor against recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs between 175 and 199 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
